perturbation.changed_text:
4.
Fees for Customizations:
[SPECIFY TIME AND MATERIALS RATES ([Indicate any “not to exceed” limit on T&M Customization costs) OR FIXED PRICE]
If the proposed price Is Increased by Supplier upon delivery to Bank of America of detailed specifications or at any other time hereafter, Bank of America may terminate this Schedule and shall receive a refund of all amounts previously paid hereunder. However, if Bank of America does not terminate within 30 days of the price increase notification, the price increase is deemed accepted and no refund will be issued.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that Bank of America can terminate and receive a refund if the price increases, but then adds a condition that if they don't terminate within 30 days, the price increase is accepted and no refund is issued. This creates uncertainty regarding the circumstances under which a refund is applicable.

7.
[Add any special items. e.g., special payment Schedule, for this Schedule.]
All invoices for Customizations must be paid within 60 days of the invoice date, unless otherwise agreed in writing by both parties. However, Bank of America reserves the right to dispute any invoice within 30 days of the invoice date; any disputed amount shall not be due until the dispute is resolved, at which time the undisputed portion of the invoice shall be immediately due and payable.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict in payment terms. It states that invoices must be paid within 60 days but also allows Bank of America to dispute invoices within 30 days, delaying payment for the disputed amount. This creates ambiguity as to when payment is actually due and what the precise payment deadline is, specifically for disputed invoices.
